result.execSummary:
The defendant William Scott Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Partial payment plan:  $50 per month. 2  day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.
Filed By Atty Ekes.

Pre-trial conference at 12-10-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 01-05-2016 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, TIH (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant William Scott Peterson in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant has filled out the Petition of Appointment of Counsel. 
BTC: Petition is granted. Payments in the amount of $35/mth beg 12/1/15 is ordered. Matter is adjourned. Defendant's Mother may go to the prior residence to obtain Defendant's personal belongings.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
